Welcome back to Sow, Grow, Repeat, the new gardening podcast from the Guardian.

In our second episode, Alys Fowler and Jane Perrone look at some of the ways you can garden without a garden. They explore the history and importance of allotments with Sara Jane Trebar of the Save Farm Terrace campaign; George McKay, author of Radical Gardening: Politics, Idealism and Rebellion in the Garden; and journalist and allotment holder Lia Leendertz. Finally, urban gardener Gayla Trail reveals what it was like to guerrilla garden on a busy public corner in Toronto, Canada.

We'd love to hear your experiences too, so let us know on the blog below, or send us a tweet.
